survfunc <- function(data, time, event, eventname) {
  out <- data.frame(matrix(NA, ncol = 7, nrow = 3))

  out[1, 1] <- eventname
  colnames(out) <- c("Outcome", "Model", rep(levels(rsdata$shf_anemia), 2), "p interaction")

  ## incidence rate
  out[1, 2] <- "Incidence"

  ev <- rsdata %>%
    group_by(shf_sex, shf_anemia) %>%
    summarise(
      ev = sum(!!sym(event) == "Yes"),
      .groups = "rowwise"
    )

  s <- rsdata %>%
    group_by(shf_sex, shf_anemia) %>%
    summarise(
      s = sum(!!sym(time) / 365.25),
      .groups = "rowwise"
    )
  r <- pois.exact(x = ev$ev, pt = s$s / 1000)

  out[1, 3:6] <- paste0(
    ev$ev, ", ",
    fn(s$s, dig = 0), ", ",
    fn(r$rate, dig = 0), " (",
    fn(r$lower, dig = 0), "-",
    fn(r$upper, dig = 0), ")"
  )

  # cox regressions
  lev <- levels(rsdata$shf_sex)
  out[2, 2] <- "Crude HR (95% CI), p-value"
  out[3, 2] <- "Adjusted HR (95% CI), p-value"

  ## crude
  for (i in seq_along(lev)) {
    mod <- coxph(formula(paste0("Surv(", time, ",", event, "=='Yes') ~ shf_anemia * relevel(shf_sex, ref = '", lev[i], "')")),
      data = rsdata
    )
    smod <- summary(mod)

    out[2, (i * 2 + 1):(i * 2 + 2)] <- c("ref", paste0(
      fn(smod$conf.int[1:3, 1], dig = 2),
      " (", fn(smod$conf.int[1:3, 3], dig = 2),
      "-", fn(smod$conf.int[1:3, 4], dig = 2), "), ",
      fn(smod$coef[1:3, 5], dig = 3, p = TRUE)
    ))

    if (i == 1) {
      out[2, 7] <- fn(last(smod$coefficients[, 5]), p = T, dig = 3)
    }

    ## adjusted individual covariates
    amod <- with(imp, coxph(formula(paste0(
      "Surv(", time, ",", event, " == 'Yes') ~ shf_anemia * relevel(shf_sex, ref = '", lev[i], "') +",
      paste(modvars, collapse = " + ")
    ))))

    ## df the number of events minus the regression coefficients.
    ## There is support for this from middle of page 149 of the book by Parmer & Machin (ISBN 0471936405)
    asmod <- summary(pool(amod,
      dfcom =
        (amod$analyses[[1]]$nevent - length(amod$analyses[[1]]$coefficients))
    ))

    out[3, (i * 2 + 1):(i * 2 + 2)] <- c("ref", paste0(
      fn(exp(asmod$estimate[1:3]), dig = 2),
      " (", fn(exp(asmod$estimate[1:3] - global_z05 * asmod$std.error[1:3]), dig = 2),
      "-", fn(exp(asmod$estimate[1:3] + global_z05 * asmod$std.error[1:3]), dig = 2), "), ",
      fn(asmod$p.value[1:3], dig = 3, p = TRUE)
    ))

    if (i == 1) {
      out[3, 7] <- fn(last(asmod$p.value), p = T, dig = 3)
    }
  }
  return(out)
}

death <- survfunc(
  time = "sos_outtime_death6y",
  event = "sos_out_death6y",
  eventname = "All-cause death"
)
anyhosp <- survfunc(
  time = "sos_outtime_hospany6y",
  event = "sos_out_hospany6y",
  eventname = "First all-cause hospitalization"
)

outall <- rbind(
  death,
  anyhosp
)

write.xlsx(outall, paste0("./output/tabs/out_", Sys.Date(), ".xlsx"), rowNames = FALSE)

footnote(default_kable(outall,
  font_size = 6,
  caption = "Outcomes"
) %>%
  landscape() %>%
  add_header_above(c(" " = 1, " " = 1, "Female" = 2, "Male" = 2, " " = 1)),
general = c(
  "Incidence =  no events, sum py, rate/1000py (95% CI)."
)
)
